Package org.jtrim2.utils

Class ExceptionHelper

java.lang.Object
org.jtrim2.utils.ExceptionHelper
public final class ExceptionHelper extends Object
Contains static helper methods for throwing specific exceptions. These includes helper method for checking arguments of methods and throw an exception if they are inappropriate.

Thread safety

Unless otherwise noted, methods of this class are safe to use by multiple threads concurrently.

Synchronization transparency

Methods of this class are synchronization transparent.

  • Method Details

    • rethrowIfNotNull

      public static void rethrowIfNotNull(Throwable ex)
      Throws the specified exception if it is an instance of Error or RuntimeException, or throws a RuntimeException exception with the specified exception as its cause; does nothing if the specified exception is null.

      This method is effectively equivalent to: 

       if (ex != null) {
     ExceptionHelper.rethrow(ex)
 }
      Parameters:
      ex - the exception to be thrown by this method. If it cannot be thrown due to being a checked exception, it will be wrapped in a cause of a RuntimeException and the RuntimeException is thrown instead. This argument can be null, in which case this method is a no-op.
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - thrown if the specified exception is null

    • rethrowCheckedIfNotNull

      public static <T extends Throwable> void rethrowCheckedIfNotNull(Throwable ex, Class<? extends T> checkedType) throws T
      Throws the specified exception if it is an instance of Error or RuntimeException, or is an instance of the given type, or throws a RuntimeException exception with the specified exception as its cause; does nothing if the specified exception is null.
      Type Parameters:
      T - the type of the checked exception type which might be rethrown as is
      Parameters:
      ex - the exception to be thrown by this method. If it cannot be thrown due to being a checked exception, it will be wrapped in a cause of a RuntimeException and the RuntimeException is thrown instead. This argument can be null, in which case this method is a no-op.
      checkedType - a type defining a Throwable, if the specified exception implements this class, it is simply rethrown instead of wrapped. This argument cannot be null. However, if null is passed for this argument, the specified exception is still rethrown but a NullPointerException will be attached to it as a suppressed exception.
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - thrown if the specified exception is null and the given exception type is null as well
      T - thrown if the given exception is an instance of the given class

    • rethrow

      public static void rethrow(Throwable ex)
      Throws the specified exception if it is an instance of Error or RuntimeException, or throws a RuntimeException exception with the specified exception as its cause.

      Note that this method never returns normally and always throws an exception.

      Note: Consider using throwUnchecked(Throwable) for convenience.

      Parameters:
      ex - the exception to be thrown by this method. If it cannot be thrown due to being a checked exception, it will be wrapped in a cause of a RuntimeException and the RuntimeException is thrown instead. This argument cannot be null.
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - thrown if the specified exception is null

    • throwUnchecked

      public static RuntimeException throwUnchecked(Throwable ex)
      Throws the specified exception if it is an instance of Error or RuntimeException, or throws a RuntimeException exception with the specified exception as its cause.

      Note that this method never returns normally and always throws an exception. The return value is simply for convenience, so that you can write:

      throw ExceptionHelper.throwUnchecked(myException);

      This allows the Java compiler to detect that the code after this method is not reachable.

      Parameters:
      ex - the exception to be thrown by this method. If it cannot be thrown due to being a checked exception, it will be wrapped in a cause of a RuntimeException and the RuntimeException is thrown instead. This argument cannot be null.
      Returns:
      this method never returns, the return value is provided solely for convenience
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - thrown if the specified exception is null

    • throwChecked

      public static <T extends Throwable> RuntimeException throwChecked(Throwable ex, Class<? extends T> checkedType) throws T
      Throws the specified exception if it is an instance of Error or RuntimeException or is of the given type, or throws a RuntimeException exception with the specified exception as its cause.

      Note that this method never returns normally and always throws an exception. The return value is simply for convenience, so that you can write:

      throw ExceptionHelper.throwChecked(myException, MyException.class);

      This allows the Java compiler to detect that the code after this method is not reachable.

      Type Parameters:
      T - the type of the checked exception type which might be rethrown as is
      Parameters:
      ex - the exception to be thrown by this method. If it cannot be thrown due to being a checked exception of the wrong type, it will be wrapped in a cause of a RuntimeException and the RuntimeException is thrown instead. This argument cannot be null.
      checkedType - a type defining a Throwable, if the specified exception implements this class, it is simply rethrown instead of wrapped. This argument cannot be null. However, if null is passed for this argument, the specified exception is still rethrown but a NullPointerException will be attached to it as a suppressed exception.
      Returns:
      this method never returns, the return value is provided solely for convenience
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - thrown if the specified exception is null
      T - thrown if the given exception is an instance of the given class

    • checkIntervalInRange

      public static void checkIntervalInRange(int intervalStart, int intervalEnd, int minIndex, int maxIndex, String argName)
      Checks if all the values of the specified interval is within the allowed range and throws an IllegalArgumentException if it is not. In case the interval is within the allowed range, this method returns immediately to the caller.

      More formally, this method will throw an IllegalArgumentException if and only if:

      intervalStart < minIndex || intervalEnd > maxIndex + 1

      This method was designed for simple parameter validation of methods.

      Parameters:
      intervalStart - the inclusive lower bound of the interval. This argument can be any possible int value.
      intervalEnd - the exclusive upper bound of the interval. This argument can be any possible int value.
      minIndex - the inclusive lower bound for the allowed value for the interval. This argument can be any possible int value.
      maxIndex - the inclusive upper bound for the allowed value for the interval. This argument can be any possible int value.
      argName - the name of the interval to be checked. This string will be included in the message of the thrown IllegalArgumentException if the interval is found out of range. This argument is allowed to be null.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - thrown if the specified interval is outside of the allowed range

    • checkIntervalInRange

      public static void checkIntervalInRange(long intervalStart, long intervalEnd, long minIndex, long maxIndex, String argName)
      Checks if all the values of the specified interval is within the allowed range and throws an IllegalArgumentException if it is not. In case the interval is within the allowed range, this method returns immediately to the caller.

      More formally, this method will throw an IllegalArgumentException if and only if:

      intervalStart < minIndex || intervalEnd > maxIndex + 1

      This method was designed for simple parameter validation of methods.

      Parameters:
      intervalStart - the inclusive lower bound of the interval. This argument can be any possible long value.
      intervalEnd - the exclusive upper bound of the interval. This argument can be any possible long value.
      minIndex - the inclusive lower bound for the allowed value for the interval. This argument can be any possible long value.
      maxIndex - the inclusive upper bound for the allowed value for the interval. This argument can be any possible long value.
      argName - the name of the interval to be checked. This string will be included in the message of the thrown IllegalArgumentException if the interval is found out of range. This argument is allowed to be null.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - thrown if the specified interval is outside of the allowed range

    • checkArgumentInRange

      public static int checkArgumentInRange(int value, int minIndex, int maxIndex, String argName)
      Checks if the specified argument is within its allowed range and throws an IllegalArgumentException if it is not. In case the argument is within the allowed range, this method returns immediately to the caller.

      More formally, this method will throw an IllegalArgumentException if and only if:

      value < minIndex || value > maxIndex

      This method was designed for simple parameter validation of methods.

      Parameters:
      value - the value to be checked if it is within the allowed range. This argument can be any possible int value.
      minIndex - the inclusive lower bound for the specified value. This argument can be any possible int value.
      maxIndex - the inclusive upper bound for the specified value. This argument can be any possible int value.
      argName - the name of the value to be checked. This string will be included in the message of the thrown IllegalArgumentException if the value is found to be out of its allowed range. This argument can be null.
      Returns:
      the value argument
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - thrown if the specified value is not within its allowed range

    • checkArgumentInRange

      public static long checkArgumentInRange(long value, long minIndex, long maxIndex, String argName)
      Checks if the specified argument is within its allowed range and throws an IllegalArgumentException if it is not. In case the argument is within the allowed range, this method returns immediately to the caller.

      More formally, this method will throw an IllegalArgumentException if and only if:

      value < minIndex || value > maxIndex

      This method was designed for simple parameter validation of methods.

      Parameters:
      value - the value to be checked if it is within the allowed range. This argument can be any possible long value.
      minIndex - the inclusive lower bound for the specified value. This argument can be any possible long value.
      maxIndex - the inclusive upper bound for the specified value. This argument can be any possible long value.
      argName - the name of the value to be checked. This string will be included in the message of the thrown IllegalArgumentException if the value is found to be out of its allowed range. This argument can be null.
      Returns:
      the value argument
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - thrown if the specified value is not within its allowed range

    • checkNotNullElements

      public static <T> T[] checkNotNullElements(T[] elements, String argumentName)
      Checks if the elements of the specified array or the array itself is not null and throws a NullPointerException if any of them is found to be null.

      This method was designed for simple parameter validation of methods.

      Type Parameters:
      T - the type of the elements of the given array
      Parameters:
      elements - the array to be checked not to contain null elements
      argumentName - the name of the array to be checked. This string will be included in the thrown NullPointerException if the array is null or contains null elements. This argument is allowed to be null.
      Returns:
      the elements argument
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - thrown if the specified array is null or contains null elements

    • checkNotNullElements

      public static <C extends Collection<?>> C checkNotNullElements(C elements, String argumentName)
      Checks if the elements of the specified collection or the collection itself is not null and throws a NullPointerException if any of them is found to be null.

      This method was designed for simple parameter validation of methods.

      Type Parameters:
      C - the type of the collection whose elements are to be checked
      Parameters:
      elements - the collection to be checked not to contain null elements
      argumentName - the name of the collection to be checked. This string will be included in the thrown NullPointerException if the collection is null or contains null elements. This argument is allowed to be null.
      Returns:
      the elements argument
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - thrown if the specified collection is null or contains null elements

    • checkNotNullMapElements

      public static <C extends Map<?, ?>> C checkNotNullMapElements(C elements, String argumentName)
      Checks if the elements of the specified collection or the collection itself is not null and throws a NullPointerException if any of them is found to be null.

      This method was designed for simple parameter validation of methods.

      Type Parameters:
      C - the type of the collection whose elements are to be checked
      Parameters:
      elements - the collection to be checked not to contain null elements
      argumentName - the name of the collection to be checked. This string will be included in the thrown NullPointerException if the collection is null or contains null elements. This argument is allowed to be null.
      Returns:
      the elements argument
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - thrown if the specified collection is null or contains null elements
